Internal systems connecting to known or.Action: Identify IP addresses associated with known/suspected compromised third-party network devices from Threat Intelligence feeds. Filter Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections originating from or destined to these IPs. Analyze http.log for unusual User Agents, GET/POST requests, or payloads downloaded/uploaded. Use correlation analysis to identify internal systems communicating frequently with these suspect external IPs.

Connections or scanning activity origina.Action: Ingest Threat Intelligence feeds listing IP addresses of known/suspected compromised network devices. Filter Zeek conn.log and scan.log for connection attempts or scanning activity originating from these listed IPs targeting our network. Analyze connection patterns and frequency using descriptive statistics or time series analysis to identify abnormal reconnaissance or connection attempts.

Requests made by internal systems to ext.Action: Filter Zeek http.log for connections where the destination IP is on a list of known/suspected compromised network devices. Identify HTTP GET requests for executable files, archives, or other potentially malicious content types. Analyze HTTP response codes, file sizes, and compare requested URLs against known phishing lures or hosted malicious payloads using correlation analysis with threat intelligence feeds. Flag internal source IPs initiating these requests.

Internal systems connecting to known/sus.Action: Filter Zeek conn.log for connections from internal systems to known/suspected compromised network devices. Analyze connection patterns (port usage, duration, frequency) for deviations from expected behavior (e.g., connections to high/unusual ports, long-duration connections). Look for entries in Zeek weird.log indicating unexpected protocol behavior or anomalies during connections to these IPs. Use frequency analysis or descriptive statistics to identify outlier internal systems or connection characteristics to these suspicious destinations.
